intro: Corispermum ochotense, commonly known as the Siberian sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is native to the cold regions of Eastern Siberia and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers and has a distinctive, low-growing, mat-forming structure. Its leaves are typically succulent and fleshy, helping it retain moisture in dry conditions. Corispermum ochotense is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is a characteristic species of the tundra and steppe ecosystems.
